fields.label: Book
fields.name: books
fields.instructions: Add or Remove Books that should be displayed on the book page

sub_fields.label: ID
sub_fields.name: id
sub_fields.instructions: Read Only !! The unique identifier of this book object

sub_fields.label: Book Title
sub_fields.name: book_title
sub_fields.instructions: The Official Published Title of the book, including Subtitle, if provided.

sub_fields.label: Authors
sub_fields.name: authors
sub_fields.instructions: Include at least one author for the publication. Co-authors should be added after the primary author

sub_fields.label: Name
sub_fields.name: name
sub_fields.instructions: Include the full name of the author as published with the book. Only include Titles (Dr., Mrs, etc) and Suffices (Jr, PhD, EdD, etc) if part of the publication.

sub_fields.label: Url
sub_fields.name: url
sub_fields.instructions: Not required. But include a url relevant to this author, such as a portfolio, blog, or other professional link

sub_fields.label: Email
sub_fields.name: email
sub_fields.instructions: Not Required. The email address for this author as it pertains to this publication.

sub_fields.label: Short Bio
sub_fields.name: short_bio
sub_fields.instructions: A short bio for this author as it pertains to this publication.

sub_fields.label: Profile Image
sub_fields.name: profile_image
sub_fields.instructions: An Image for this author as it pertains to this publication.

sub_fields.label: Publisher
sub_fields.name: publisher
sub_fields.instructions: The name and address of the publishing company as to be listed within the publishers page of the book. For example: Zondervan, Grand Rapids, MI

sub_fields.label: Excerpt
sub_fields.name: excerpt
sub_fields.instructions: Separate snippets with a new line if necessary.

sub_fields.label: Date Available for Purchase
sub_fields.name: date_available_for_purchase
sub_fields.instructions: The date the book can be purchased online or in stores.

sub_fields.label: Online Availability
sub_fields.name: pricepoints
sub_fields.instructions: A list of the prices of the book for each format, edition, and entrypoint.

sub_fields.label: ISBN
sub_fields.name: isbn
sub_fields.instructions: The ISBN of the publication

sub_fields.label: Edition
sub_fields.name: edition
sub_fields.instructions: The edition of the work, if any.

sub_fields.label: Price
sub_fields.name: price
sub_fields.instructions: The price associated with this format of the book

sub_fields.label: Endorsements & Reviews
sub_fields.name: endorsements
sub_fields.instructions: For displaying endorsements for this publication

sub_fields.label: Endorsement Text
sub_fields.name: endorsement_text
sub_fields.instructions: The snippet of the endorsement or review

sub_fields.label: Rating
sub_fields.name: rating
sub_fields.instructions: The rating associated with the endorsement or review

sub_fields.label: Reviewer Name
sub_fields.name: reviewer_name
sub_fields.instructions: The full name and title of the person leaving the review

sub_fields.label: Reviewer Organization
sub_fields.name: reviewer_organization
sub_fields.instructions: The full name of the organization, if any, where the endorsement was printed or that the reviewer represents.

sub_fields.label: Review URL
sub_fields.name: review_url
sub_fields.instructions: Either the URL where the full review can be read, or the url of the organization associated with the review above.

sub_fields.label: Is Canonical
sub_fields.name: is_canonical
sub_fields.instructions: Only Check This Box if you intend the content on the Wordpress site to be the canonical version. Otherwise, if this content is being exported to another site, the external site will be considered canonical.

sub_fields.label: slug
sub_fields.name: slug
sub_fields.instructions: The endpoint for book on the author's website. For example, if the book title is "In His Image", a good slug would be "in-his-image". Please only use lowercase letters, numbers, dashes, and (if you must) underscores.

fields.label: Events & Speaking Engagments
fields.name: events
fields.instructions: For adding speaking events, conferences, book signings, and other public appearances

sub_fields.label: ID
sub_fields.name: id
sub_fields.instructions: READ ONLY unique identifier for the event in the DB

sub_fields.label: Event Name
sub_fields.name: event_name
sub_fields.instructions: The name of the event

sub_fields.label: Event Description
sub_fields.name: event_description
sub_fields.instructions: A description of the overall event highlighting your particular role.

sub_fields.label: Featured Image
sub_fields.name: featured_image
sub_fields.instructions: The primary associated with the event

sub_fields.label: Event Type
sub_fields.name: event_type
sub_fields.instructions: Toggle between regular events, online events, and mixed online/offline events

sub_fields.label: Venue Name
sub_fields.name: venue
sub_fields.instructions: The name of the Venue

sub_fields.label: Street Address
sub_fields.name: street_address
sub_fields.instructions: Full Street address, included unit number if applicable.

sub_fields.label: City
sub_fields.name: city
sub_fields.instructions: City where the event will take place

sub_fields.label: url
sub_fields.name: url
sub_fields.instructions: For use with Online or Mixed Event Types

sub_fields.label: Event Admission
sub_fields.name: event_admission
sub_fields.instructions: Only use this field if there will be tickets required for the event. If there are tickets required, but they are free, add a ticket price, but set the price to zero.

sub_fields.label: Admission Price
sub_fields.name: admission_price
sub_fields.instructions: The price for admission. Enter 0 for free tickets.

sub_fields.label: Ticket Purchase Url
sub_fields.name: ticket_purchase_url
sub_fields.instructions: Where tickets can be purchased for this event.

sub_fields.label: Ticket Availability
sub_fields.name: ticket_availability
sub_fields.instructions: Toggle this as necessary

sub_fields.label: On Sale Date
sub_fields.name: on_sale_date
sub_fields.instructions: The Date and Time from which this pricepoint is available.

sub_fields.label: Is Canonical
sub_fields.name: is_canonical
sub_fields.instructions: Only Check This Box if you intend the content on the Wordpress site to be the canonical version. Otherwise, if this content is being exported to another site, the external site will be considered canonical.

sub_fields.label: Slug
sub_fields.name: slug
sub_fields.instructions: The endpoint for the event to be displayed on the author's website.

fields.label: Frequently Asked Questions
fields.name: faqs
fields.instructions: This should include a mix of informational, marketing, and urgent questions. The right types of questions will not only inform users but increase the SEO value of the site. Remember, people come to search engines to ask questions and find answers. What questions does your site answer? Ask and answer those questions here.

sub_fields.label: ID
sub_fields.name: id
sub_fields.instructions: READ ONLY

sub_fields.label: Question
sub_fields.name: question
sub_fields.instructions: The full text of the question

sub_fields.label: Answer
sub_fields.name: answer
sub_fields.instructions: The answer to the provided question

sub_fields.label: Is Canonical
sub_fields.name: is_canonical
sub_fields.instructions: Only Check This Box if you intend the content on the Wordpress site to be the canonical version. Otherwise, if this content is being exported to another site, the external site will be considered canonical.

sub_fields.label: Slug
sub_fields.name: slug
sub_fields.instructions: The endpoint for the event on the author's site

fields.label: Netlify Hook Url
fields.name: netlify_hook_url
fields.instructions: ***DO NOT UPDATE*** This is used by netlify to update the site based on changes to custom fields
